title: Compound Interest Formula
text: We have the compound interest formula $$A(t)={P\left(1+\frac{r}{n}\right)}^{nt}$$

title: Find the Values of the Variables
text: Because we are starting with $3,000, $$P=3000$$. Our interest rate is 3%, so $$r=0.03$$. Because we are compounding quarterly, we are compounding $$4$$ times per year, so $$n=4$$. We want to know the value of the account in $$10$$ years, so we are looking for A(10), the value when $$t=10$$.

title: Substitute the Value
text: Substitute the values into the formula to get the answer.
